intro: Epacris miniata, commonly known as the miniature epacris, is a species of flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the heath family, Ericaceae, and is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red in color. The plant produces its flowers on spikes, and the leaves are narrow and evergreen, often covered in a fine layer of white or grey hairs. Epacris miniata thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in heathlands and open forests, preferring full sun to partial shade.
